heading: Content Block 6
summary: Psychological supportA.L.E.G. Associationoffers free psychosocial support to Ukrainian refugee women in Sibiu Country with translation into Ukrainian. Venue: Infocenter Ukraine at st. Mitropolii, 17 (DWS headquarters).Hereyou can find the registration link, and for other questions you can write directly tocontact@aleg-romania.eu.TheInternational Rescue Committeeoffers psychological assistance to Ukrainian refugees, TCN citizens, the local population in Romania, survivors of gender-based violence, people with serious mental illness, unaccompanied children, the Roma community. Consultations are held in Russian, Ukrainian and Romanian. Contacts: Katarina Mitic, Program Coordinator:katarina.mitic@rescue.orgMore information

heading: Content Block 7
summary: EducationFind outherehow you can enroll your child in primary education and whatdocumentsare required.More information about the education system in Romania

heading: Content Block 8
summary: Organisations offering their supportFind support in your city - explore themap for service providersnear you!Sus Inimaresponded to the refugee crisis in Ukraine through access to free basic food and hygiene products, access to therapies and medical services, Romanian and English language courses, temporary accommodation for refugees, day center for Ukrainian children, educational infrastructure for Ukrainian children. Contact:contact@susinima.eu/ +40 751 138 783.

heading: Content Block 15
summary: Women's CenterIf you need support in accessing reproductive health services as well as support in navigating the health system or you need services dedicated to victims of domestic violence, click here.Ask for help

heading: Content Block 16
summary: Counseling for people living with HIVIf you arrive in Romania and need free, anonymous and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services, you can receive the support of specialist doctors from 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.Ask for help
